intro: Clermontia parviflora var. calycina, commonly known as the Kona mountain mint, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, often at higher elevations. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
